title: Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program
description: Comprehensive scholarship for academically talented yet economically disadvantaged young Ugandans to pursue undergraduate and graduate studies.
eligibility: Ugandan citizen, excellent academic record, demonstrated financial need

title: Government of Uganda Scholarship Scheme
description: Annual scholarship program for top-performing Ugandan students to pursue undergraduate studies in priority fields at Makerere University and other public universities.
eligibility: Ugandan A-level graduates with excellent grades

title: DAAD Scholarships for Development-Related Postgraduate Courses
description: Scholarships for young professionals from Uganda to pursue Master's degrees in development-related fields in Germany.
field: Development Studies, Agriculture, Environmental Science, Engineering
eligibility: Bachelor's degree, 2+ years work experience, English/German proficiency

title: Chevening Scholarships
description: UK government's global scholarship programme for one-year Master's degrees in the UK for outstanding emerging leaders from Uganda.
eligibility: Bachelor's degree, 2+ years work experience, leadership potential

title: African Development Bank Scholarship Program
description: Scholarships for African students, including Ugandans, to pursue postgraduate studies in development-related fields.
field: Agriculture, Economics, Engineering, Health Sciences, Social Sciences
eligibility: African national, relevant academic background, commitment to Africa's development

title: Australia Awards Scholarships
description: Long-term development scholarships for Ugandan students to undertake full-time undergraduate or postgraduate study in Australia.
provider: Australian Government Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
eligibility: Ugandan citizen, academic merit, leadership qualities

title: USAID/Uganda Higher Education Scholarship
description: Scholarships for Ugandan youth to pursue undergraduate degrees in STEM fields at Ugandan universities.
eligibility: Ugandan citizen, strong STEM background, financial need

title: Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Plan
description: Scholarships for Ugandan students to pursue postgraduate studies in other Commonwealth countries.
eligibility: Ugandan citizen, first-class degree, commitment to development
